subject: Re: [junit] Runtime arguments to be submitted to MyTestCase
msgSnippet: ... with ... changed ... the ... No, but it seemed to me that you needed to change JUnit in order to use inheritance; if you do not need to change JUnit in
messageBody:
On 2002-06-08 at 18:27 NOUSHI Reda wrote:

>> >About the shipping, I need to run junit as it is my frontend and
>> >MyTestCase inherits from a junit class. That's why I ship junit
with
>> the
>> >software.
>>
>> Great. I get it. Can you merely extend JUnit, then, rather than
>> changing its source? Instead of inheriting from
>> junit.framework.TestCase, compose it -- would that work?

>Let's split it in two!

>I won't change it's source, as long as I can work around it! And if I
>can't, I'll tell my client that this part of the software (junit
changed
>source) has to be released in GPL, and I'll immediately submit it to
the
>mailing list. If he's not ok with it, he'll have no product!

>When you're talking about composition, does that imply that I'm
>infringing junit's license agreement when I'm inheriting?

No, but it seemed to me that you needed to change JUnit in order to use
inheritance; if you do not need to change JUnit in order to use
composition, then so much the better.

J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
